notes: The Avalanche listed Drouin as Out for Wednesday's (Jan. 8) game against the Blackhawks.
Zetterlund is likely to play Friday (Jan. 10) versus Utah, but he's dealing with a lower-body injury that puts his availability in question, as per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey.

Lyon did not return to Tuesday's (Jan. 7) game against the Senators.
Lyubuhskin is doubtful to return to Tuesday's (Jan. 7) game versus the Rangers.

The Blue Jackets announced on Wednesday (Jan. 8) that Monahan is getting a bone scan and is expected to miss some time with a wrist injury. But he should tentatively be considered questionable for Thursday's (Jan. 9) home game against the Kraken.
Chytil did not return to Tuesday's (Jan. 7) game against Dallas.
Bernard-Docker sustained a high-ankle sprain that is expected to keep him out long term, per TSN 1200 Ottawa on Tuesday (Jan. 7).
Faber did not return to Tuesday's (Jan 7) game against St. Louis.

Fasching is day-to-day but won't travel with the club for its upcoming road game against the Golden Knights on Thursday (Jan. 7), according to Ethan Sears of the New York Post.
The Flames announced that Zary had to be helped off the ice due to a lower-body injury and is not expected to return to Tuesday's (Jan. 7) game versus Anaheim.
Malenstyn did not play on Monday (Jan. 6) against the Washington.
Head coach Sheldon Keefe said Monday that Haula could miss a few weeks due to a sprained ankle, according to Amanda Stein of the Devils' official site.

The Hurricanes have listed Carrier as Out for Sunday's (Jan. 5) game against the Penguins.

The Utah Hockey Club placed D Robert Bortuzzo on the Injured Reserve.

Miller will miss at least two weeks after suffering a fracture in his larynx, according to Mitchell Clinton of the Jets' official site.

Demko is close to returning, but he isn't expected to play Wednesday (Jan. 8) against the Washington, as per Dan Murphy of Sportsnet.
Murphy did not play in Wednesday's (Jan. 8) game versus the Avalanche.
Jost has returned to Carolina to undergo further evaluation, as per Cory Lavalette of the North State Journal Thursday (Jan. 2).

Nichushkin is expected to be sidelined for 7-10 days, according to Head coach Jared Bednar.

The Colorado Avalanche placed F Ivan Ivan on injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 31).
Pettersson did not play in Wednesday's (Jan. 8) game versus the Capitals.
Marchment is considered week-to-week after he was struck in the face by a puck on Friday (Dec. 27) against the Wild, as per Mike Heika of the Stars' official site.
The San Jose Sharks placed D Jake Walman on Injured Reserve Thursday (Jan. 4).
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Haydn Fleury on injured reserve on Monday (Dec. 30).
The Nashville Predators placed F Cole Smith on injured reserve and will miss 4-6 weeks.
Faksa did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 7) game against Minnesota.
Gadjovich did not play in Wednesday's (Jan. 8) game against Utah.
The Senators announced on Friday (Dec. 27) that Amadio will be unavailable for a while, head coach Travis Green told TSN 1200 Ottawa.
The Ottawa Senators placed G Linus Ullmark on Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 7).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Nicolas Roy on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 27).
The Sharks announced on Saturday (Dec. 28) that Vanecek is week-to-week with a fractured cheekbone, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Ivan Barbashev on injured reserve Thursday (Jan. 2).
The Buffalo Sabres placed F Jordan Greenway on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 20).
The Minnesota Wild placed F Jakub Lauko on Long Term Injured Reserve Wednesday (Jan. 8).
Regula was never taken off the season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday (Dec. 11), per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
The Lightning said on Thursday (Dec. 19) that Moser is expected to miss 8-10 weeks with a lower body injury.
The Maple Leafs said on Tuesday (Dec. 17) that Stolarz is expected to miss the next 4-6 weeks after undergoing a procedure to remove a loose body in his knee.

Martinez did not play in Wednesday's (Jan. 8) game versus the Avalanche.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed F Nicolas Deslauriers on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 6).
The New York Islanders placed G Semyon Varlamov on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 19).
The Ducks said Zegras had successful knee surgery on Thursday (Dec. 12) to repair a torn meniscus and is expected to miss six weeks.

Seguin will be out of action for 4-6 months when he undergoes surgery on Thursday (Dec. 5) for a left-side femoral acetabular impingement and hip labrum, per Lia Assimakopoulos of The Dallas Morning News.
Chinakhov completed a solo skating session on Wednesday (Dec. 18) but is without a timeline to return, per Aaron Portzline of The Athletic.
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Oliver Kylington on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 1).
The Utah Hockey Club said on Saturday (Nov. 30) that Lamoureux was placed on injured reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche announced on Saturday (Dec. 28) that Wood is not close to a return but remains on his timeline, per Ryan Boulding of NHL.com.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Davis Perron on injured reserve on Saturday (Dec. 28).
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Dylan Samberg on injured reserve on Sunday (Nov. 24).
The Maple Leafs placed D Jani Hakanpaa on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 31).
The Seattle Kraken placed F Jordan Eberle on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Nov. 30).
The Bruins announced on Sunday (Dec. 1) that Lindholm remains week-to-week, according to Conor Ryan of The Boston Globe. He is still on injured reserve and is not close to being available to return.
The Washington Capitals placed F Sonny Milano on long-term injured reserve on Wednesday (Nov. 20), per Stephen Whyno of the Associated Press.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
Reilly (heart procedure) has been placed on LTIR on Tuesday (Jan. 7). He will be out indefinitely.
The Hurricanes announced that Andersen will undergo a procedure on his knee on Friday (Nov. 22 )which will knock him out of action about 8-12 weeks, per TSN and RDS Hockey Insider Pierre LeBrun.
Leddy will accompany the Blues on the team's upcoming four-game road trip but still remains on injured reserve as of Sunday (Dec. 1), per Lou Korac of NHL.com.
The Blue Jackets announced on Tuesday (Oct. 22) that Gudbranson underwent successful shoulder surgery on Monday (Oct. 21) and is without a timetable to return.
The Utah Hockey Club announced on Wednesday (Oct. 23) that Durzi has undergone successful shoulder surgery and is expected to return in 4-6 months.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jordan Gustafson on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jakub Demek on the injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve.
Jenner has resumed skating on Tuesday (Dec. 10) and would miss 5-6 months, per Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
The Maple Leafs said Jarnkrok had surgery on Monday (Nov. 18) to repair a sports hernia and is now considered month-to-month.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Canadiens said that Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee on Tuesday (Oct. 1) and is out for 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
The Devils said that Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery on Thursday (Oct. 10) and is without a timetable to return.

Doughty took a significant step in his recovery process by resuming skating on Tuesday (Dec. 31) and it's possible that he will be in the mix to return to game action sometime in January, per Zach Dooley of the Kings' official site.
Couture has not resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 1) and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The Utah Hockey Club said on Wednesday (Oct. 23) that Marino underwent successful surgery and is expected to return in 3-4 months.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Evander Kane on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Jesper Fast on long-term injured reserve on Wednesday (Oct. 9).
Brossoit had another procedure done on Friday (Nov. 29) and is expected to be out for another six weeks, according to Blackhawks head coach Luke Richardson.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Igor Chernyshov on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Wednesday (Nov. 13) that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, per Adrian Hernandez of SBNation.com.
